contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox astronaut | name =Yuri Mikhailovich Baturin | image =Baturin.jpg | type =Cosmonaut | nationality =[[Russia]]n | birth_date =12 June 1949 | birth_place =[[Moscow]], [[Soviet Union]] <small>(now [[Russia]])<small/> | occupation = | selection =[[List of astronauts by selection#1997|1997]] | time =19d 17h 44m | mission =[[Mir EP-4]] ([[Soyuz TM-28]] / [[Soyuz TM-27]]), [[ISS EP-1]] ([[Soyuz TM-32]] / [[Soyuz TM-31]]) | insignia =[[File:Soyuz TM-28 patch.jpg|35px]] [[File:Soyuz TM-32 patch.png|35px]] | awards ={{Hero of Russia}} |}} '''Yuri Mikhailovich Baturin''' ({{lang-ru|Юрий Михайлович Батурин}} (born 12 June 1949, [[Moscow]], [[Soviet Union]] {now [[Russia]]}), is a Russian cosmonaut and former politician.<ref>http://www.spacefacts.de/bios/cosmonauts/english/baturin_yuri.htm</ref> Baturin graduated from the [[Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology]] in 1973, and is the former head of National Security; he is also an author in [[constitutional law]].<ref>Yury Baturin. ''Studies in Constitutional Law''. Moscow: ILPP, 2008, 114 pp, with illustrations [Russian: Батурин Ю. Конституционные этюды. - М.: Институт права и публичной политики, 2008 – 114 с., 80 с. ил.</ref> Baturin was also a [[astronaut|cosmonaut]] who flew on two missions. His first spaceflight, sometimes called [[Mir EP-4]],<ref name=EA-EP4>{{cite web|url=http://www.astronautix.com/flights/mirep4.htm|title=Mir EP-4|publisher=Encyclopedia Astronautica|accessdate=5 January 2011}}</ref> was launched with the spacecraft [[Soyuz TM-28]] 13 August 1998, and landed with [[Soyuz TM-27]]. He was a Research Cosmonaut for this mission, which lasted for 11 days 19 hours 39 minutes. His second spaceflight was [[ISS EP-1]], which was launched with the spacecraft [[Soyuz TM-32]] on April 28, 2001, and landed with [[Soyuz TM-31]]. This mission was notable as carrying to first paying [[space tourism|space tourist]] [[Dennis Tito]]. For this mission he was designated a Flight Engineer; the mission lasted for 7 days 22 hours and 4 minutes.<ref>http://www.spacefacts.de/bios/cosmonauts/english/baturin_yuri.htm</ref><ref>http://www.astronautix.com/astros/baturin.htm</ref> He married Svetlana Veniaminovna Polubinskaya, (born 1954); they had a daughter, Alexandra Yurievna Baturina, (born 1982), a student at the Moscow State Academy of Law.<ref>http://www.spaceref.com/focuson/tito/baturin.html</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Baturin, Yuri Mikhailovich | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 12 June 1949 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Moscow]], [[Soviet Union]] <small> (now [[Russia]])<small/> | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Baturin, Yuri Mikhailovich}} [[Category:1949 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Russian cosmonauts]] [[Category:Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology alumni]] [[Category:Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology faculty]] [[Category:Heroes of the Russian Federation]] [[Category:Diplomatic Academy of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation alumni]] {{Russia-bio-stub}} {{Astronaut-stub}}
